review: Sat for more than 25 minutes when we just ordered an appetizer with drinks. No explanation, no manager visited. Was not busy enough for a 25 minute appetizer.
Was so excited to see TGIF reopen - but, 45 min to get food, two of 5 orders were wrong, food had obviously been sitting. Not good. Too many other options in Roseville to put up with that!

not a nice way to treat returning customers. we got screwed by being part of their loyalty program and tge best the mgr can say is go online and complain. the our meal comes and they serve it with glue not blue cheese. then i am watching a game a they changed the channel. i politely asked to have it changed back and still not changed. go to Chilis and get treated better.

I see a lot of poor experience postings so let me state the positive. HAPPY HOUR HAPPY HOUR!  Great prices (half off some appetizers) and cheap drafts.  My favorite appetizer is the hot wings (bone in) of course.  You get like ten wings for 5 bucks.  You can barely buy at that price uncooked at your favorite supermarket.  Happy hour runs from 3PM to 7PM Mon-Fri. Give ol Friday's a chance people.  I know many people missed the franchise when they went out of business.  Everything takes time to smooth out the wrinkles.  I too have experienced longer than usual wait on food the couple times I have been most recently, but so far the staff have been very nice at the bar and door. I will be back for more because where else can you get a large draft beer and plate of wing for roughly ten bucks?
DO NOT EAT HERE, Went there this past Monday night and Found tiny cocka roaches on our appitiezer plates. WE RAN OUT OF THERE! No wonder most of the Fridays in Sac closed.  BIG NO NO.

Due to all the negative reviews I feel the need to defend TGI Friday's a little bit here. I have personally eaten there twice since it (re)opened and have had a great time.  Sure, I experienced longer wait times and a few food mistakes but that is to be expected when I go to a restaurant that just opened.  My server was amazing the first time so I asked for her again the second. If Jennifer E. waits on you, expect great service.   Read the negative comments but take them with a grain of salt, and try the restaurant for yourself.

Get the Fried Green Beans... like french fries, but BETTER. Also the Jack Daniels Platter is a WINNER and a TGIF MUST! I couldn't believe all the TGIFs closed in Sac when that idiot went bankrupt. Thank goodness they have this location in Roseville now!

WASTE OF TIME. DO NOT EAT HERE. I came here with my friends because we missed TGI Fridays since it closed.  Came on a Thursday night and sat in the bar area (not knowing Happy Hour was about to start).. the waitress carded us and one of our friends didnt have an ID so she tried to escort us out of the bar area and on to the other side of the restaurant.. seriously??? we asked to speak with her manager and she copped attitude with up and we all caught her rolling her eyes.  RUDE. After we spoke to the manager, we were able to stay in our seats but left with the waitress-with-the-attitude. Clearly there were 4 of us in the table... why did she only give us 2 menus???? and clearly not all of us were ready to order, but yet she took one order and OF COURSE, one of our friend's food came out early. she never gave refills even though she offered and she also never gave us utensils... we had to chase down a few other employees just so we can start eating our food. happy hour is retarded. there are way better happy hour menus around the area. they dont even have a separate menu for their happy hour... our waitress had to look at the regular menu and let us know which appetizers were included o_0 My friend and I ordered the same exact plate (chicken and shrimp pasta) and his came out wayyyy spicier than mine. His pasta was so much darker than mine and very inedible. so not only were they inconsistent with serving but they were also inconsistent with their food. complete waste of time. i was so disappointed with this re-opening.

My sister, brother, and I went here on a thurday night. My brother ordered the ribs and they were so over cooked they were crunchy. I ordered some pasta with chicken and that too was over cooked. The only thing that tasted decent was the salad my sister ordered. Also the service was good at first then we waited 45 mins for our waitress to take care of the bill. Needless to say I will NOT be going back there.

I have to agree with the other low ratings.  To sum up, had to ask for utensils and napkins, our waitperson disappeared (never saw her again) after our food was delivered. We sat on the patio because it was nice outside.  We never once were offered a refill, mainly because our waitperson never came back. We had to beg for our check from some other waiter who happened to be walking by and likely saw me looking around for somebody (Anybody!). He said he would find our waitress, she never showed but he came back about 15 minutes later with our check. I didn't want him to "get away" so I had already gotten my credit card out so I can hand it right to him before he disappeared. He took my credit card and the check back inside and lo and behold, about another 10 minutes later, a new waitress brought it back with her apologies. She said that someone had "transferred" our table to her (the 1st waitress had gone home), but no one told her that she was taking over our table.  We NEVER saw a manager, or anyone who looked like one.  There was one guy wearing a different color shirt (it was grey, not the usual TGIF red), but he didn't make any eye contact with anyone. Lastly, the patio was filthy.  There were tables that sat without getting cleaned up from the time we arrived until we left an hour and fifteen minutes later. Some poor kid who looked very young and inexperienced (not a waiter, but he was the one who originally walked us out to the patio), came out and poked around one of the tables, picking up one or two glasses and taking them into the restaurant. Then he came back out and picked up a to-go box someone left behind and then carried that one item into the restaurant.  Then he just seemed to give up and disappeared.  There seems to be no one assigned to cleaning tables and no managerial oversight whatsoever.   We were excited so see the restaurant re-open and provide some badly needed new jobs, but at this rate, they better get their act together as there is plenty of competition in Roseville.  Why put up with this when you have BJ's, Yard House, Red Robin, Mimi's, etc, etc. within less than 1/4 mile away?  In this economy, it is a treat go spend a little money and dine out.  Why waste it on a bad experience?  The management needs to get it together or get replaced.
Went to this reopened restaurant twice. Both times, service was extremely slow and they weren't very busy. The food  was OK but waiting 45 minutes for it is unacceptable.

I went to TGI Friday's during happy hour and it was A-OK.  The food was good and the service was polite, it wasn't the most AMAZING thing I ever had but it was worth the price.  The only issue I had with TGI Friday's was the fact that the commericals advertise 2 for $10 but the offer has not started.  That was frustrating but that was it!

The Main menu is pretty mediocre... But I have to say I love their late night happy hour. For my fried green bean fries paired with an awesome wasabi dipping sauce and a berry majito shaker my bill was under $15.00, the shaker was basically 1 drink with leftovers in the shaker! The servers are very pleasant and love that they have an heated patio for those long summer nights!

I ordered the baby back ribs with Jack Daniels sauce and the ribs was really dry with a slathering of sauce. I wouldn't order that again, but the Long island ice teas were tasty. Our waitress was proficient, but it took forever to get food on the table. She mentioned that the kitchen was backed up, and our food was still a half hour wait. Overall I think the food is way over price for what it is and I would not come back unless it's happy hour. Foodies beware.

The food was bad... Ribs were dry and crunchy and Steak was overcooked and tough... The only thing that saved this from being a 1 star was the waiter. He did an excellent job! Even brought out our kids food early because he could see  that they were starting to have issues sitting still... So excellent service and not so great food. order wisely and good luck!
Sesame Jack Chicken Strips are AMAZING and Oreo Madness is the best chocolate dessert in the world!!!

I went fridays and had a terrific time. The food was great the drinks were cold and served promptly especially for being so busy.  I give the staff at Fridays a lot of credit it is never easy to open a large restaurant and they seemed to be coming along quickly with service and food quality.  My guess is that all of the other posters have been masters of their  professions in just a few days... So sorry but it does take some time to become proficient in anything you undertake whether it is food service or carpentry you can't master it overnight.  It is always easy to be critical when one only sees what is on the surface.  Fridays has only been open for 10 days and it is my opinion that they will be just fine once the staff gets a little more experience.  I will be back.

Wow, that was bad.   I just got back from a lunch date with my fiancee, and this was the worst dining experience I have had in ages.   First, the food.  We both ordered the new Spicy Craft Beer Cheese Burger.  The food was boring, borderline flavorless, and poorly assembled.  It looked amazing on the menu, but really wasn't great.   Now, on the the part that really sucked: The service.  Our waitress was awkward, which is fine, and rude, which was not.  She kept trying to take our order when we were clearly not ready (menus open, actively reading), but disappeared for a while when we were ready to order.  Drink refills took ages.  She dropped off the check, which was for the wrong table, and didn't come back for over 10 minutes.  At no point was she even mildly apologetic about getting things wrong, or our long waits in a restaurant that wasn't even close to busy.   In summary, this is not the Friday's I remember.  I will not be returning.

This restaurant was just re-opened.  Recommendation - Close the doors again cus this place sucks. TGIDHTGB - (Thank God I don't have to go back)  It's not that this restaurant is horrible but it is far from good.  It is so commercialized that their food tastes that same way.  Nothing special about it at all.  I have not been a fan since they got rid of the delicious Italiano sandwich years ago.  It is not the same Friday's from the 90's, thats for sure!

Eh, I'm pretty sure I won't be back.   Ordered three items to go yesterday - salad, pretzels and hummus.  I was told on the phone it would be 15-20 minutes, I came 25 minutes after I ordered and the items were still not done. I wasn't escorted to the bar to wait for the items, I was just left awkwardly standing in the lobby.  When the hostess came back out with the items, she insisted on 'going over them' with me.  She then proceeded to take the containers out of the plastic bag, put them on the BENCH SEAT in the lobby, not one of the many nearby bar tables and open each one, showing them to me.  If it werent for everything being in the containers, I would have refused to take any of it, though it was still gross. They left dressing off the salad and the pretzels were a bit burnt.  But I had already waited 10 minutes since I arrived, so I just took the stuff and left.  We ended up putting some caesar dressing that we had at home on the salad, and the pretzels were ok. The only reason why they aren't getting 1 star is that the hummus was really good, but not enough to go back.   Expensive food, weird service practices, and lack of attention to detail.

What is the most paramount singularly important element in a sucessful business?  come on people say it with me, we all know what it is....  customer satisfaction!  Customer satisfaction will be the downfall of this place.  We went there at lunch after school shopping....  we avoided the noon hour just so we wouldnt have to worry about it being busy yet early enough in the lunch period to where there should be enough servers before the powers that be decide to cut half the staff and let the remaining few run around like chickens withouth their heads.  we were seated promptly by the server in the main aisle of the dining room, so being stuck in some obscure corner couldnt be used as a reason later in this story.  Within 5 minutes i was aggravated because i was parched and nobody had come by to say hi, be right with you, etc etc...  although plenty of servers did walk by us.  after about 8 minutes one did pause at our table and say she will be right with us, but then proceeded to take care of more of her own customers, even bus two tables as she walked by us again and again.  Now i know, right there i should have left but i had just spent more bonding time at staples with my son than any mother should have to do and i did not want to go out without at least a drink of water.  Finally after 14 minutes I asked the same server who sat us and who had been walking back and forth by us if she could get us a server...  somehow she managed to pull off a shocked look that we hadnt been served yet although the flaming daggers i was throwing at everyone by then, the folded menus, the now overly obvious looks we are tossing everywhere and the complete voidness of anything wet on our table should have been a clue to her.  She got us our water after apologizing for nobody catching us yet and told us our server would be there within 30 seconds.  Well she was back with the waters before we saw the server again, who did turn out to be the same server who stopped at our table an extra long commercial stopset ago and told us she would be right with us.  She took our orders with expedience, herself apologizing for the delay and then was off.  she refilled our water when they were empty, (not before as I like, but empty) then brought back our burgers...  i ordered the veggie burger with sweet potato fries, ...  michael's order was correct but of course no sweet potato fries on mine.  she immediately apologized and got me a fresh order, which in retrospect i am glad happen because the ones on my plate were old and would have been sent back.  Of course by now i had read what my fellow yelpers were saying about this place and should have not even stepped foot in the establishment based on the poor reviews...  but who knew.  of course the waitress was super friendly and tried to redeem herself so she squeezed the balance of the two burgers with water check totaling 18.53, she got the remainder of a 20 as a tip which was 1.47 more than i wanted to give her but i think she got the point.  as someone else said on yelp...  close the doors back up again....  if you cant provide fantastic customer service within 2 months of being open... close again.  the only thing that matters in a restaurant business is great customer service and this place didnt have it today nor does it appear have they had it for awhile now.

I was nervous to come here after seeing the horrid reviews, but my boyfriend wanted to try it out so I didn't have much of a choice. Surprisingly, it wasn't so bad. The food was just okay. We got the spinach dip appetizer, I got a southwest wedge salad, and my boyfriend got the sizzling chicken & shrimp. I feel like it's hard to mess up spinach dip and a salad, so I'll only comment on the entree my man got. The chicken was actually pretty good. The shrimp were small and mashed potatoes were missing something- they felt like they were made with some premade powder stuff. I got some mango cocktail which tasted like juice, no alcohol.  We happened to go during late night happy hour. It was priced pretty well. Some of the appetizers were half off, some beers were $3, and $2 off mixed drinks. I would suggest they fork out the money to get a happy hour menu though. The servers having to point out which appetizers are part of the deal makes it confusing, kinda. Customer were was okay, nothing special but not bad.
So glad Friday's is back! Jack Daniels Chicken Strips are my fav!

The food was good but I asked my server at least 3 times if they could turn up the air conditioner and it never happened. My friend and I couldn't wait to get out of there. We felt like we had just worked out. I don't think they really cared. I think they save on the air if it's not crowded. Not a good idea. Not happy at all

Very Disappointed.  Ordered the  Sizzling Chicken ad Shrimp to go, along with the kids spaghetti with fruit.  The kids spaghetti had very little sauce and it was mostly chunks of dried tomatoes...not saucy at all.  Kid wouln't eat it.   The fruit was supposed to be peaches and grapes.  Nope.  It was a can of mandarin oranges, juice and all.  The chicken tasted fine, however there was this weird Velveeta cheese -onion - pepper mixture on the bottom, congealed with grease.  The side Caesar salad turned out to be a green salad with ranch.  They gave us a small container of dressing for a giant salad.  Needless to say, it was a dry salad.   I had such high hopes and was too tired to go back and get this corrected.  We will not go back again.

Don't want to even give them one star. The 3 times ive been there since there reopening and I still get that unfriendly vibe from the servers and bartender. They don't seem happy to be there and lack the drive to even care about there guests. I had a beer the other night with coworkers and the bartender was a guy with brown medium length flat hair . Didn't seem approachable and didn't end up asking if I wanted another beer and waited and waited and waited.. Oops he didn't tell us he was leaving and transferring it to another person who also didn't introduce themselves... We finally got our seconds when a friendly curly brown haired guy came to us with a smile(the only cheerful one there) and asked us, think he was the Barback. So I tipped based on his attitude and also cuz I know that servers live off tips as income(im a server)  so pitty tip I guess. But yes keep in mind that Fridays is no longer the Fridays it once was.... Don't think it'll last that long .

Went here because haven't been to a Friday's in a while. Yeah... probably should have gone elsewhere... :-/ There isn't much of a waiting area. So if it's a busy night hopefully it's not too cold or hot when you go. The staff seemed nice enough. Our waitress seemed nice... But she wasn't very attentive. When we finally got our appetizers a good wait, she was not the one who brought it out to us, nor did she check on us for quite some time. We had to ask for utensils and napkins. Note to any servers out there, if you see a table with kids (I have 3), you are 99% of the time going to need to make sure they have enough napkins. There is another good wait between the appetizers and the main dishes. I was disappointed when my steak came out a little more over done than what I had asked. Other than that the food was ok.  I probably won't be heading back. In that area of Roseville there are just so many more options for where to eat.

Went here with my kids around 11:30 and it was not that busy.  The server was very attentive and nice but the food took forever to come out.  1 table came after us and got their food first and the table that was there before us got their food last.  WTH??  The place wasn't even crowded.  Our server brought out our bill and we were still waiting for our food, that's how long it took and with two kids it's hard to keep them occupied for that long.  The food wasn't that good and my son's mac and cheese tasted like the noodle were cooked in dirty mop water.

Do not go here for Happy Hour.  There are only select appetizers that "qualify" for the 1/2 price off.  We went there and the waitress told us that we had to sit in the bar to get the Happy Hour prices. She gave us the regular menu not the Happy Hour menu, so we ordered appetizers that were not 1/2 off. When our bill arrived we told the waiter but he did not care. He did not even offer to take some money off.  Our appetizers came out late followed 2 minutes later by our entree. Our waiter never came by to see how our food was. I had to find him to get our bill and boxes to go. We were never asked if we wanted more to drink. You get the picture.  The help just doesn't not seem to interested in customer satisfaction.

Every now and then I get a craving for Fridays- green bean fries or Jack's chicken- and every time I go I find something newly disappointing. From crappy kids meal options to disposable tableware to half-assed happy hour menus, they just seem to be phoning it in.

We walked in Sunday night for dinner, and ended up walking right out. There is basically no waiting area and really no hostess station at the front, so when I first walked in, I really didn't know what I was supposed to do. I thought maybe we came in the wrong entrance, but it was the front door. Do we seat ourselves or...?  So we waited there for at least five minutes before being "greeted" with a rushed "have you been helped?" Um, I don't know, how about a "Welcome to Friday's, have you been helped?" or "Welcome to Friday's, where would you like to be seated?" with a smile or even a remote amount of enthusiasm. Apparently working at Friday's must be pretty bad times, huh?  Anyway, during our initial wait, I had a chance to glance around and see that there were numerous empty tables, so I thought we would be seated quickly, especially as a party of two. No dice. The hostess told us the wait for a table would be at least 25 minutes, but that we could pick a spot in the bar and eat. So, I took the pager and we kind of stood by the door for a minute. Then we decided we'd just go ahead and sit in the bar to eat and watch a game. As I handed the pager back to her and told her we'd rather go ahead and eat in there, she stated we could only sit and wait in there, but not order anything because there was no wait staff. So I said "Huh? That makes no sense," and laughed. We left and ate at On The Border, where they have an idea of what customer service really is. I won't come back to Friday's, and I'll make sure to let my friends know why.

The food is ok, the service is not that great and sometimes poor. The food takes a long time to get too. I asked the host to be seated at a booth since I was with a toddler and I was told there weren't any available. I was seated ten feet away from a clean booth that was in my servers area. There were only a few people there and another couple asked the server to move to a booth and it was no problem at all. They were moved to the clean booth near me. After a couple other booths were cleared I asked my server (the same server the other couple had) if I could move and I was told I'd have to ask the host. Nobody was waiting so I don't see what the issue was. Last time I went I had to get my own silverware and it took forever to get food. I don't think they will stay in business long unless they can make some very serious changes. There are at least a dozen or more restaurants within two blocks that have much better service and better food at the same price point.

Wow, was this place bad. We arrived and ordered a beer.  We were told that the beer tap was broken, it could only dispense warm beer, and so all they had was bottled beer.  Wow, a bar without a beer tap. It was also really cold.  It was warmer outside.  We asked about that, and were told that the thermostat was broken.  You could hang meat in there, it was so cold. We ordered, and it took forever to get our meals.   When they arrived, we still had no silverware.  We asked for silverware.  After about 4 minutes, we just walked across the aisle and got silverware off the opposite table which was unoccupied.  After almost 10 minutes, the waitress returned to tell us that there was no wrapped silverware in the kitchen.  Guess the waitress didn't think to look across the aisle. Getting  water was even harder than getting silverware. The food was OK, but the service wasn't worth visiting.  It's just Bad!!!

I wish I could give them zero stars but it's not an option.  My fiancé and I came here with his sister and her husband.  We were sitting at the bar for a total of two hours and experienced the following: 1. Our drinks remained empty and pushed up against the front of the bar for 15-20 minutes at a time without our "bartender" noticing or offering another drink.   2. Our queso dip appetizer arrived 45 minutes after (around the same time as dinner) it was half empty and looked like it had been microwaved several times over (please refer to the picture I posted)  3. We had to ask for silverware and napkins an it took about 10 minutes for any of the 3 bartenders to respond to our raised hands and "excuse me's" (keep in mind there were only 2 customers to every one bartender so they were NOT understaffed... However, poorly managed.  4. After complaining to the manager he offered to bring us new queso (keep in mind by this time we had finished eating our food) Then he disappeared with nothing but a poor apology.  5. Oh and NO waters until we were paying our bill If you look at past reviews I normally leave  5 stars but TGIFridays is not even worth one.  I predict that they will be closed down again in our area soon if they keep this up.

Ok. I was scared to go here given the reviews. My group wanted to relive old times when Fridays was the "it"place. We were seated and ordering when I read about the pest problem. Yikes! Now I was really scared but everyone was drinking their drinks and happy. I checked all the food that came thoroughly just in case. Kaleb was our server and while he "upsold" he did it in a nice nudging way. They were out of a menu item I really wanted. They really should announce the "86s" ahead of time so you can settle in on food that is actually there. The bar area is really nice and large. Sitting there you could see the TVs, other people, the bartender, etc. The bar was the biggest reminder of Friday's of old. The dining room and bar were cold. Even those of us who have thicker skin were chilly. A previous poster had said that as well. Could it be on purpose?. All in all it was A OK. The prices are high. $10 potato skins. A pint of beer over $5. The food tasted good so it is somewhat bareable.

My wife and I have been going to TGI Friday's for over 10 years and considered it one of our favorite restaurants. We would average 5 to 6 dinners a year at this location and others. Over the last couple years we've noticed the prices increase and the portions decrease. Used to be able to dine for 2 for around $25 and take home left overs. Now, dine for 2 around $40+ and scrape every bite to get a meal. Funny thing is they use the same large plates so the meals actually look dinky now. Couple other things, we always ask to sit away from the bar area to eat a peaceful meal but the music still blasts way to loud over the booths. We've also seen a decrease in service as they still make incredibly silly mistakes like not returning your credit card after paying, refilling the wrong kind of iced tea, and leaving off one of your 2 dinner sides. Sad to say this is no longer a favorite of ours.

I have tryed this place a few times. The food is great but the time frame it takes to order and get your food in is realy disapointing. It took over 45min for our appitizer and about an hour to recieve our main course not to mention our drinks were never refilled. They are bad with service even when they are slow. Dont waist your time.

BURGERS ARE CRAP!! Just drove across town to eat at the famous tgi's for a Valentine's dinner. Both of us ordered bacon cheeseburgers that were absolutely delicious at the elk grove location. This time we ordered the same medium rare and waited over 35 minutes for well done burgers. Both had to go back and received well done AGAIN!! After another 30 minute wait. The waiter was telling me that medium burgers are hard to cook lol. I was too hungry to care anymore but the burgers tasted like frozen old bull meat and the buns were stale and re-used. Both burgers cost $10ea without discount. The waiter didn't seem so bright either. will never go there again..ever!!
Slowest service ever! They told us 15-20 minutes and came back twice after the 20 minutes to tell us 5 more minutes. They served two parties that were seated after us.
Food was acceptable although a little pricey.  Service was the absolute worst. This place could really give TGIF a bad name.

While food is your average large chain fare it was their impeccable service that receives my review. It was so impressive I believe the server was listening to my thoughts. I mean I literally was thinking 'I could go for a water' and it would appear! Wonderful happy hour!  Great staff.

Haven't been to a TGI Friday's in awhile but after hearing all the ads for the Jack Daniel's menu items thought the family and I would go. BIG MISTAKE!! Though the server was good the bar and kitchen need a complete overhaul! Waited 15 minutes for 2 slushie drinks for my son and myself. After 15 minutes we were informed that they were out of them. Very slow bar with only 12 or so customers. The food took 45 minutes to get to us and then the appetizers were cold. There were only 10 dinners in the restaurant. so busy was not a excuse. Couldn't imagine if they were busy how long it would have taken. I should have went with the reviews. This place is one to AVOID!!! Many other choices nearby.

It should be telling that I'm writing this from PF Changs across the street. We got to TGI Fridays and were seated almost immediately... then proceeded to wait ten minutes for someone to come over. And her first question was, "are we ready to order?" not, "how are you?" or, "can I get you a drink?" I said no and requested a gluten free menu. She said she'd be right back and a minute later a different person dropped off the menu and walked away, and proceeded to get drinks for a table that was seated after us. So I turned to the GF "menu" and found that it was more of a puzzle. It had every item on the menu with a slew of symbols like a key. And my choices were basically plain salad or a steak. They have made virtually no effort in accommodating those of us with dietary restrictions.  After looking back and forth between the puzzle and the menu, I realized it had been another ten minutes and we decided to leave. A minute after walking into PF Changs, where we know and love their GF menu, we were already treated a thousand times better than we were at Fridays.

I was beyond excited when this place re-opened. It used to be a favorite hangout spot and I was hoping the love affair would return. However, the service we received was awful. We had to wait a long time for everything. When we first walked in, we had to look for someone to seat us. Once finally seated, it took a while until someone brought us menus. It then took a while for our waitress to bring menus, and take our drink order. We repeatedly had to grab other servers and bussers to ask if we could have our beverages refilled. It also took a long time for her to take our food order and then to bring us the food. I had asked for the Jack Daniel sauce initially to go with my JD chicken strips and when the food came she forgot the sauce. I asked for it again and by the time she brought it out, the food was cold. We also had to ask for the check. We had a fairly simple order and there were only two of us. The service was so bad and the food mediocre. Sadly I won't be going back.

Months of reviews of the Galleria TGI Friday's seem basically the same as the experience we had recently.  No management involved. Staff poorly or not trained at all.  Staff seems miserable. Inconsistent service and food.  Takes forever for food to arrive. Food arrives but no silverware.  No check back after the food  is served. I could go on... No mention of Happy Hour, we had to ask. We ate in the bar, and were happy to watch basketball.  Then suddenly, someone turned on BLASTING music. That ruined the experience and the meal. One entree had five little pieces of pasta stuck all together, as if they scraped the bottom of a pot and rescued the remains. Sure didn't look like the menu picture. No way to complain, because no staff around.  We were happy to see the place reopen, thinking that "new" people would do a good job and want to build up clientele.  Not so.  From the unfriendly, unwelcome at the door ("where do you want to sit"?)  to the lack of attention for our food, we now know better. Very high prices for poor service and so-so food.  We won't be back!

Went there with 4 other people for a few drinks and food after a long week at work.  We got seated quickly.  We then ordered our drinks and waited about 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive.  It got worse from there.  We had to flag down our server to get our 2nd round of drinks ordered.  Then the wait again of about the same 15 minutes.   We were assured that they now had an additional bartender & the GM was helping as well so the service would improve.  Needless to say, it didn't.  No one checked on us.  We had to ask for water and of course that did not come quickly.  No one asked us if we wanted food.  We went elsewhere for food & we will NOT be returning.  TERRIBLE!
glad theyre open again, best late night happy hour!

This location is actually pretty slow, for it being in a prime location across from the gallaria I thought it would be busy. But even when they were slow they service was slow and they food came out even slower. I ordered the cajun shrimp and chicken pasta which was actually really good.

Glad to see that tgi Fridays opened again. Not reply impressed overall.  They decor remains unchanged except the bar area. All of the flair has been removed and they have put up a ton of big screen TVs. Happy hour is great because it is not only on weekdays but on Sundays during football season.  The staff was nice but not very attentive. We waited along time for drink refills and the food was slow.   When the food arrived I was also not impressed. I was hoping for the food to be the same as I remembered it. But it was not. The potatoes were flavorless and the pasta was overcooked. My hubbys ribs were overcooked as well. The only thing that remained good was the jack Daniels bbq sauce, which I would take home by the gallon. Overall I was not impressed.  Sorry tgifriday. I still gave 3 stars because I would go back for happy hour. After a couple beers I would still eat there.

I came here one time a few months ago and had a girls night. I though the food was good and my drink was great... I've been back twice since then - my first time back was during lunch time and beer served was extremely warm plus we waited for about 20 minutes before someone even bothered to ask if we were ordering food. We ended up leaving instead of eating lunch here. The second time was to give it another shot thinking maybe my previous experience was just a mishap... Nope. This time wasn't any better. The service took forever, as did the food. This is no longer a place that my family and I will have as a lunch or dinner option.

Avoid this restaurant at all costs! In fact, Roseville should tear it down and salt the earth so no further incarnations of this horrid chain should rise again.  We have lived in this area for the past decade and every once in while we have decided to give TGI Friday's another chance and each time it has missed hitting even the low expectations we've set for them. The food is actually good, the challenge comes in trying to obtain some. This is one chain restaurant without a captain at the helm. Service is practically nonexistent, it's clear they constantly run with a skeleton crew that can't even keep up with the minimum service needs of those unlucky enough wander past the red & white awnings. My family and I have walked out of this restaurant numerous times because of the extraordinary waiting times to have a server come to the table. Clearly it's a sign of a struggling franchise in it's final death spasms, and not just a symptom of an off night or an ineffective manager.  With all the consistently good dining establishments within eye sight of this restaurant, don't be drawn into TGI Fridays because of the immediate seating -- that seating is only available because of TGI Friday's consistent ability to underwhelm it's former customers!

This is my opinion and review. My family and I went for the Jack D. Burger and appetizer for $10. Mozzarella sticks have no cheese at all. Totally hollow inside. I told the waiter and he said he can make a couple more but we all shared the sticks and my wife got the only one with cheese out of about 9. I figured the next one has to have cheese. My 4yo son didnt care cuz it was fried. By then it was too late, I said no thankyou, blaa. The pita bread app. was good though. The burgers had stale, cracked buns & J.D. sauce that was too condensed. Gross!!! The chicken strips were big and about 6 of em but too much breading on the tiny chicken tenders inside. The fried green beans were great. The So Co  bourbon burger at C.J.'s blows it away. Plus  we would have only spent $15-$19 vs $40-$50.

Not planning on coming here again. I didnt mind that we waited a while to be seated and a 40 min wait just for the food. ordered the jack daniels rib eye with shrimp& the order was wrong. got a regular rib eye steak no jack daniels sauce & hella dry for medium well there was no shrimp. I told the waiter & he had an "oh crap I f'ed up the order" face but I can get some out for you but i didnt want to wait any longer than I already did..the lettuce.for the salad taste like dirt. I ended up snacking on my boyfriends food. At least his was good and cooked to order.  Our waiter was nice.just not the best experience and food wasnt so great.

I like the food but the wait is too long. 10-15 minutes to order drinks. Another 10-15 minutes to get them. Order when you get the drinks to shorten the wait but plan on another 20- 30 minutes to get the food. Seriously! Bring some friends so you can talk and hang out to pass the time. I still go about every other month because the Jack Daniels chicken, ribs, and shrimp are awesome!

My Husband and I stopped in for lunch one evening while we were out shopping, we do not go out often due to our rambunctious 3 year old.  Anywho, we stopped in and it was not crowded at all....perfect for a family with a toddler!  The hostess was friendly, and our waiter was awesome! He was prompt though not overbearing (some waiters can be borderline stalkerish...you know what I am talking about).  He brought our daughters food out a little early so she would have hers to munch on and not get restless...and ours came out shortly after. We did not have to ask for refills, he was on top of it! The food, while your average chain restaurant food, was pretty good too....it was fresh, warm and delicious.   Very pleasant experience!

Not a place I plan to visit again. Sticky tables in booths. Everyone seems to accept it as part of the decor. Paper napkins stick leaving paper behind. Entry is not inviting. When entering you face a wall. No greeter. Young staff on this Sunday. Maybe lacking a seasoned management presence.

My spouse and I have dined at Friday's locations, all over the country, for many years. We were devastated when all the Friday's in the Sacramento area closed down a few years ago.  Conversely, we were thrilled when the Roseville location reopened. The "new" Friday's in Roseville, however, is not up to par, based on five or six visits.   Hope springs eternal, as there have been some occasional flashes of past trips to Friday's, but they were interspersed with some downright lousy experiences. For example, on our last visit, just a few days ago, the food was superb.  The service from our waitress Kelly, who has served us before, was spot on great.  It was a very nice experience.  On our visit prior to that, the service was dandy, but my blue cheese burger was as dry as a bone, well-well done.  I had ordered it medium rare.  When our waiter asked if my burger was medium rare and I showed him a dark gray rubbery mass, he was visibly horrified.  He offered to replace it with one cooked properly, but I declined, preferring to dine at the same time as my spouse rather than us eating in shifts.  Besides, we've all heard those stories about upset cooks seeking revenge on folks who send food back to the kitchen.  You know; spitting on the vittles, etcetera.   I wouldn't take the risk.   The two star rating reflects more than the above described experience.  I can recall two other bad visits to the new Friday's, including a  really pathetic Club Sandwich, and one time where we were forgotten by a waitress and sat endlessly in restaurant purgatory, waiting and waiting and waiting.   In short, this place is wildly inconsistent.   Great sometimes, terrible sometimes.   One more point.  Friday's was always known for its contrived ambiance of all kinds of  interesting, neat-o things hanging from the walls and ceiling.  Stuff like old signs, beat up catcher's mitts, and black and white photos of folks like Ernest Hemingway.    This new Friday's in Roseville has almost none to those effects.  Like the restaurant on the moon, there's no atmosphere. I suppose we'll give this place a few more tries, based on previous years of satisfaction with Friday's.

A little over priced for some items but I am sure the location goes based on a standard pricing. We did go for late night drink and the place seemed a little empty. The drinks were great and our server  was awesome! I am sure if we are looking for drinks we will make our way back to Fridays.

Unfortunate experience.  Our server never came around before, during and after we arrived.  It took forever to get our food.  We'll never go back here.  Your time and money is truly better spent at other restaurants.  Waste of money and a wasted evening.

It's almost as if I have to subtract a star each time I come here. The last time we were here, we found a long blonde hair in our fried mozzarella. Not sure if it was in the marinara sauce or the mozzarella stick.  It was about a month since that happened. On this last visit, I had a coupon for $5 off for $15 or more from the Entertainment coupon book. We had ordered three entrees, two appetizers, three mixed drinks and a soda. What I also have is the Fridays phone app, you can earn rewards good towards food, drinks and dessert. I have racked up a bunch of rewards and haven't used any of it, I looked through my rewards and I had a coupon for $8 towards food. When our bill came, I showed the server both coupons and I knew he would tell me I couldn't use both but i thought it wouldn't hurt to ask, and when he said I could use only one, I opted to use the coupon for $8. I write the serial number for the coupon off my phone and he walks back and tells me the manager said that we couldn't use it because two of our dinners were the Pick 2 for $10 entrees. I was confused because the reward was good for any food purchase? I then told him how about the $5 coupon from the Entertainment book and he says, I already ran your card through. WTH? I was annoyed. On top of that, I lost my rewards points for the $8 coupon, because it shows that it's been redeemed.  I was a bit disappointed but I thought, why??? The last few times we've come here we've had either bad food or bad service.  To sum it up, there are a lot of better dining choices than to waste your time and money here.

My wife and I went to TGIF for dinner. We had the 2 for 10 Jack daniels steak with all the fixing, It was fantastic the wedge salad with blue cheese and the steak fries are killer. they had 3 dollar beers in 14oz glasses. the service was great and we enjoyed our experience. You don't leave there hungry. We used to go to outback or applebees and always left angry about the service and hungry. TGIF is our new place. Next time I want to try that big burger it looked delicious.
Had the chicken parmesan, wasn't that impressed. Portions was small and wasn't very satisfied.  Service was amazing though. Very happy with my waitress

Not sure why there not many tgi Fridays in Sacramento , then need to re-open more. Great environment and the staff are friendly and always asking if we needed anything. Food was good, I got the bbq pulled pork sandwich, then being Thursday got 3x appetizers since the waiter showed they were only 3 bucks each on Thursday. Topped it off with the Oreo dessert. Great service, good food and good environment place for all ages.

I love TGI Friday's...it's one of my favorite places to go...the main reason why I love it so much is because of the jack Daniel's chicken...it's soooo very yummy...its amazing and wonderful. The food was great on this last visit...just what I was expecting...super yummy and exactly what it is suppose to taste like. However the service I received was a whole different story... We were seated very quick after arriving so that was nice...it was a Wednesday night so they were not very busy. Then we get to our table and at first the waiter seemed okay...but then... When we were eating and having a conversation (because that's what people go out to eat for...to eat and talk) the damn waiter kept interrupting our conversation over and over again...for lame crap to..and he kept pushing us to get desert. Listen if I want to eat deserts then I will...leave me to enjoy my dinner and talk...go away! So after having to deal with this damn guy all through out our dinner...it was time to go...we had enough. Now on to the next topic...having a rewards program. So I have a rewards card and when you earn enough point you get to pick a reward...well the only reward that I could use with the meals we pick was a $8 off one...so I pulled up the code on my phone and gave it to the damn waiter and he wrote it down and left. Then he comes back with our bill....I look at it and said you didn't put the $8 off code in...and he said ummm yeah I have to do it later...I said no when I hand you my card you you will hand me with a bill for the correct amount...other wise you will end up charging me more. So he said okay I'll go take care of it...I say fine I'm going to the restroom. When I'm walking out of the restroom he stops me and says....ugh ummm the code doesn't work...I said maybe you wrote it down wrong...and gave him the code again. So really it wasn't that you have to put the code in later...really it didn't work most likely because you wrote the code down wrong....and you were what...thinking I'm as dumb as you and wouldn't notice. Ugh so finally it all get taken care of and he brings the bill and walks off. I waited for maybe 1 minute...and he doesn't come back. So I get up and go to the little register booth and handed my bill and money to a different waitress who was nice and took care of it. Then we left...it was the worst experience I have ever had here. Every other time...it's great...food is good...service is good...but this time not so much. So I say if you are going to go here and the try to seat you in Dylan's section say NO please move me...he was terrible!  Don't sit in Dylan's section!

Great happy hour! Food is reasonably priced. We had Kirk as our server and he was awesome! We requested a booth at the bar; Kirk immediately made a booth become available for us when there wasn't any.  He was very attentive and checked on us multiple times throughout our meal. The quality of the food was very satisfying. We went on a Thursday night; there was no wait to be seated and food came in a timely manner. I recommend this place. :)

This place was fantastic :) my boyfriend and I came to this TGI Friday for dinner just last night and we had the best service. The hostess was a young gentleman who offered us the bar. We don't mind the bar. I actually prefer the bar :) anyway, we just missed happy hour but the bartender was kind enough to offer us the happy hour menu. Drinks were perfect and mozzarella sticks were a delight. And only for $3. We shared their Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta and the sizzling chicken and shrimp. Lots of wonderful flavors and everything looked delicious. The place isn't too loud. They have a ton of tv screens. This place is clean, family oriented or just a casual night out. And the people who work their are pretty cool. We'll be back soon :)

these guys were ok I love tgi Fridays I use to go to it when they were open in elk grove but this one the food was slow to come out and the salad was not all that great the only reason why they are getting 2 stars is cuz the waiter was nice and hospitable other wise it would only get 1 star

Ehhhhhhh... Super friendly staff, but dang, the food was awful... I had a black bean burger, had 3 bites and put it down, never touched it again. They had a great appetizer though, pretzel stick with beer/cheese dip (had bacon in it... can't go wrong with the big B word). Other than the appetizer, total blehhhh, 2 stars for the friendly service, too bad the food was sooooooooooo bad...

Ok so my hubby and I are on a lunch date, we just so happened to be in Roseville and decided to stop on in. Hell I haven't been to a Fridays in about 10 years maybe (hella long I know) To start the hostess tried to sit us near the bathroom when there were plenty of other seats available. I wasn't about to sit near the shitter just to eat at a damn Fridays, so we find other seats and ask for menus. Immediately the server comes over and gets drinks going, I think she was offended that we didn't want drinks. WE saw they had a special and had to search the smaller table side menu to find the deal that should have been told to us when we first got the menus. Then the fried blonde server insists (I mean reaches over and changes pages) on showing me the 500 calorie menu ( okay she tried it!!) and then tried to cover it up by saying "what would you want that for your fine". After being fat shamed I ordered a salad that I could have made at home and saved money. Needless to say I wont EVER return and anyone I know who happens to be in Roseville Ill make sure I tell them about my experience. I should've left her a note but then it  would've ended up on the net like all the other notes people leave servers/waitstaff

Excellent happy hour food and drink prices!  We enjoyed potstickers and spinach dip at half price.  Great cocktail selections - the Skinny Girl Cosmo cooler was excellent (not on happy hour) though.  Nice kid friendly atmosphere.  Jordan F. (our server) was wonderful!

Taking a much needed date night of dinner and a movie we made the mistake of going to TGI Fridays in Roseville. The waiter was great and the place was clean, but the food was way over cooked. We had a double blue cheese burger that crunched when you bit it. My wife  had the parmesan crusted chicken that was also overcooked and the size of a larger chicken nugget. For the price of what we paid, I could have had better food at a fast food chain.

My wife and I went on a Saturday night and the wait wasn't too long, which was the highlight of the evening. Our waitress was attentive without being overbearing, but she didn't get my wife's order quite right.  The biggest shame of the evening was the food. I got an appetizer sampler and one app was warm, the second lukewarm, and the third was cold.  My wife had a sandwich and a salad. For the salad, my wife ordered balsamic and halfway down the salad, the lettuce was coated in ranch, like they dumped part of someone else's salad in the bowl or added ranch before they realized it should be balsamic. For the sandwich, my wife ordered it without cheese and it came with cheese. By the time they came out with a new sandwich for her, I was basically done with my meal. Years ago Friday's was all the rage. But they should just let this chain die.
Terrible. $15 for a margarita?! Never again!!!! Manager was rude. Very upset!! She could have handled it a lot different. Thanks for embarrassing us in front of the whole family. I will not be back.
Great food and customer service. I love their slushies! Burgers are made really well. Had the jack Daniels burger with mashed potatoes! It was awesome and our waiter was nice and helpful!

Tonight was the first time I have ever eaten at. TGIFridays.  We sat in the bar area so that we could watch the Giants game.  We started out with potato skins.  We got them in a reasonable amount of time.  I was incredibly disappointed.   They deep fry the potatoes just like BJ's but they don't even come close in flavor at all. They stereotyped greasy. They had no flavor at all.  The cheese was scarce and the bacon was super undercooked.   We ordered the Jack Daniels burger ans I had a classic cheeseburger.  They main course was nothing to rave about.  I could get a better tasting burger at in n out.   The reason that I even gave 2 stars is because our server was so attentive and friendly.  I don't remember his name though.
Great food always.
our server was awesome in the bar but i got very, very sick after eating here :( i ordered off the late night menu and got cheese sticks, jack daniel wings and strips, and their fried green beans. :\

Good cocktails. But whatever you do, don't order food. The worst food I've had in a restaurant. My wife ordered the flat bread pizza. It seriously looked like they went to the store and bought their own brand of frozen apps and cooked it up. I ordered the Jack Daniels Chicken & Shrimp. Horrible. Had the have a new piece of chicken cooked because the first one was like a piece of charcoal. The mozzarella & tomato salad side sucked.  Tomatoes were wilted and it was covered in Italian dressing. Not balsamic and oil. The Parmesan fries, totally nasty. Soggy & oily. So not worth $18.  I gave 2 stars- one for the drinks and one for the nice server.

Great food!! Service was also very good!! Lots of tv's and a full bar...half price appetizers during happy hour.  I had the chips and spinach dip and was amazing!!! For dinner I had the shrimp and mashed potatoes!  It was very good! The menu tells you the calories per item and I liked that about the menu.  I will definitely come back to this restaurant.

Haven't been in a number of years due to poor quality food.  Decided to give it another try and was ever so disappointed.  JackDaniels burger was very forgettable and greasy.  My husband ordered the Rib Eye and shrimp and the rib eye was a joke!  I wish I had a photo.  It looked like a hangar steak.  It was barely a half inch thick and was gray in color.   Not giving them another opportunity.

Came in last night before we went to thunder valley to see george lopez. Omg best food ever. I got jack daniels chicken burger, fries w extra seasoning, side order crutons, my husband got ribs and two sides. All very good. We also love to come on tue and thur for there three and five dollar appatizers you cant beat that when they originally like 8-12 a piece. Reccomend to anyone in the roseville area.                                        Rodriguez family                                        Auburn ca O by the way join the stripes reward program so worth getting free meals

Love the servers & staff!! Always very attentive and funny. Food was good, but now has gotten better.. more upscale a little, along with a little more pricey. Never a long wait & that jack daniels sauce!!!  Overall a great place.

Revisited This was the first time I came back to dine here since it re-opened over a year ago? I used to work for the previous franchise owner, but that's besides the point.  Came here for happy hour and ordered the Loaded Potato Skins... melted cheddar topped with crispy applewood-smoked bacon and served with green onion sour cream. I guess you can get the frozen version of this at selected grocery stores as well.  It came with 8 pieces and that was enough to get me full! I've always liked Friday's signature potato skins.  Happy Hour is half priced and ended at 7:00p. My hubby, on the other hand, had the Jack Daniel's* Ribs... full rack of slow-cooked tender baby back pork ribs, served with fries and cole slaw.  He seemed to have enjoyed his food, cleaned out his plate. We sat at the high pub table chairs near the bar area... this pleased my hubby as he kept tabs of the score of his favorite baseball team.  There were TV's all around this area... I counted at least 8 to 10 at the bar area itself, and there were more all around the restaurant. We were pleased with our server as he kept checking on us if we were okay or if we needed something.  Overall, it was a nice time to just unwind. A-okay. Review #0210

Me and my BF walk in and takes like 5 min just to get seated during lunch hr and it's completely empty. Then we get seated then it takes another 10 min in order to just get a glass of water. Then 15 min later our waitress just shows up and was like ohh I didn't know you guys where here.. What do u want. So I order... He orders then asks to order an extra side. She says no and refuses and says we can't order an extra side... And argues with us. This was a terrible experience because I was super excited about eating here too.

We have given this restaurant several tries even though the food has always been ok at best. But when we saw endless appetizers...we thought, WHY NOT. I should have just thought NOT! According to this location they do NOT participate in that WIDELY ADVERTISED promotion nor does any other location in Sacramento. Like everyone else duped into their doors by this, we were already there so we sat down. We should have left.  We ordered the bbq chicken flat bread as one of our appetizers but midway through eating. We agreed they were ok except for a weird bitter taste. After uncovering the massive amount of cheese we found them to be BURNT, JET BLACK, BURNT! We stoppef eating them and notified the waiter who returned them for a new batch which was good service untill we had finished our salads and dinner was about to be served with no returned appetitizer. We told the waiter to forget the flat bread and he offerred to 'TAKE IT OFF". Our bill came to $54 which included the flat bread. When we questioned him on the charge he explained we ate 1/2 of the 4 piece appetitizer and could not "TAKE IT OFF". REALLY! Then advised us by taking off the cheese that was purposely covering this BLACKENED MESS OF A FLAT BREAD we consumed more that 1/2 of the appetitizer. By the way we didn't eat the cheese, just removed it.  Well there it is YELPERS. Go somewhere else!

Great food, excellent service, and I absolutely love that they include the calorie count on the menu!  As someone who is on a path to restoring my health and shedding excess pounds, I am quite happy to have begun coming to the TGI Friday's in Roseville.   Unlike many people who choose (or need) to set strict dietary changes in order to become healthier or lose weight in general, when I began my quest I felt that to be successful I'd need to monitor my food choices while still allowing myself to opt for foods at least somewhat close to my previous preferences.  So when I found the calorie counts on the TGI menu, it allowed me to have a once a week or so awesome meal while not blowing out the calorie count.

Very disappointed in the fact that we drove all the way from Natomas to enjoy the endless appetizers after receiving an email that let me enter in my zip and this being the only Friday's around. We arrived to read a sign on the door stating this location is not participating in the special. Epic fail!!

Me and my wife went for happy hour.  I say it was indeed.  Reasonable price and tasty food.  I was not disappointed because I expected it from a franchise such as TGIF.  This particular franchise here in Roseville have pretty good service and the waiting was not that bad.   Although we came during the week, still I was expecting a longer wait throughout but that wasn't the case.  Our waiter was very attentive and polite.  All in all I was satisfied with the service

The husband and I haven't been to a TGIF in years. After hearing on the radio about the endless appetizers we decided to head to this location. Once we were at the door there was signage saying they are not participating in the promotion! We turned around and walked right out. Lost a customer before they walked in the door. Very sad.
Food okay took 30 min for apps. Took another 20 min for food. So 50 min on wed at 4:30 pm 5 ppl at bar. Disappointed for bad service took to long

Great food, awesome service...our server was Jay. He was a pretty awesome dude, not overwhelmingly friendly for the sake of tips, but genuine. He was really quick to bring out our food..we were starving so that was great! We also didn't have to wait forever for our bill. Everything was timed perfectly. Next time we come back we're going to ask for Jay because he just made everything perfect! :)

Food was ok. Flat iron steaks were good, lobster was over cooked. Nothing spectacular. But we waited over 45 minutes to get our food once we placed our order. We saw people come into the restaurant, eat, and leave before we had even been served.  Wasn't good enough to make a return trip.
NO ENDLESS APPETIZERS - don't be fooled into visiting this location after seeing the endless advertisements!
Not as good as I remember. The food is overcooked, dry, or cold. Will not be returning.

Such a good restaurant, as long as you aren't expecting a 4 star meal. Great staff, especially at the bar. Tamara, Kurt, Cory, Old school and D are the best. Jordan is a great server and Erika is the best hostess ever. Trust me, just go! You won't be disappointed.

Saddest restaurant I've EVER been in. I felt like I needed Prozac as soon as I entered...should've taken that as an omen. The food was disgusting, salty, nothing like I remember TGIF's being (remember the one on Howe Ave?). There was NOTHING on the wall. No ambiance whatsoever. I think depressed people come to drown their sorrows at the bar because that's also where our "server" stayed the entire night! No drink refills. No smiles. It's not Friday here people :(

So I came here despite everyone complaining that they are not part of the $10 AYCE appetizer promotion - plus we had a $20 gift card. Walk in and honestly the restaurant could use a facelift or a really good deep cleaning - the place just looks old and dingy - i'd never pick TGIF over Chili's because of this. That being said - we sat at the bar - completely sticky and there's only 1 bartender for the ENTIRE BAR AREA. So that means bar, tables, chairs etc... It took about 10 minutes for her to even acknowledge us, even though we were one of 4 couples there around 6PM on a weeknight. I will say their 1/2 off appetizers are worth it - would i ever pay full price for these? NOPE, but for 1/2 off they were worth it - especially the chicken finger things and the potato skins! The food was decent - we also ordered some of their small platters, though I'd say some are not worth it - they taste like they are previously frozen, not freshly made.  But the reason for the 3-star review - the service just sucks. Only 1 person and it may/may not be her fault, but have more employees who are more attentive. There is no reason why it should have taken us like 25 minutes to get our bill when we were clearly done eating - though no one checked on us - we had to ASK. I won't be back for service, if I do go back it's just for those potato skins.

Service was terrible!! Waited for a long time finally got menus from the kid that was standing at the door when we walked in.  Server was slow to come to table got order wrong.  Food was greasy and not pleasant.  Sat with empty margarita glass at edge of table (HINT) waiting for another (more $).  Menus were so dirty sticky was just really gross!!  There were more employees standing at door then there were servers..... Must be a terrible manager "managing" this place. Came for "Happy" hour....... Nothing happy about it! :(

HORRIBLE service!! The restaurant wasn't even busy & the waiter would check in at our table every 15 minutes. Had to wait to get a refill for a long time & it took them forever to give us our check. Not coming back.
Very poor everything was dry tasted like they just heated up frozen food. The only thing that was good was the slushs but that's about it got a bad gut ache from everything else

Was craving broccoli cheddar soup, and found out TGI Fridays has it on their menu. I ordered the broccoli cheese soup and potato skins as a to-go order. The soup is absolutely tasteless and has a disgusting consistency. Soup is served with some stupid crackers (no bread bowl available...just crackers, which I threw away). Got the potato skins because that's what they're known for, and I had never tried them before. Um, $10 for 8 tiny pieces of potato covered in fake cheese and fake bacon? Never again.

This place needs to shut down. I will never eat here again. Such unprofessionalism. From the waiters to the managers. Service is horrible.  The food you can get anywhere.  Nothing special. Service is absolutely horrible! Do yourself a favor and go to the fountains across the street and eat at any restaurant there Jack"s, Dave and Busters, just to name a few. I wish I had gone over to the fountains before I wasted my time and money on this dump.

Went for happy hour with a large group and the server was awesome! He was able to provide great service and he maintained composure and didn't allow the large group intimidate him, which I find when dining at other establishments with large groups.

Went there to have dinner and see the last few inning of the Giants game.  Place was relatively empty. The hostess decided to sit us right next to the bathroom in an empty restaurant away from any kind of tv. Go figure.  Food was descent and never been to a TGIF restaurant before but I kept thinking I was in an Irish pub because of all the wooden decor and how the place was setup.

I took a date here on a Thursday night about 5 mins before closing the kitchen. Our waiter named Dylan served me and my date and was very great at hosting us. He recommends great food for indecisive people! He even made us feel welcome even though we felt bad for coming in so late. Dylan was a very accommodating waiter and made my day that much better through his positive attitude toward his job. I really recommend anyone who comes in to ask for Dylan, he is very passionate about making sure his guests are taken care of.

Disappointed with my decision to eat here tonight. Hubby ordered rib trio and enjoyed two of three sauce choices. When asked how things tasted and mentioning that the rub was not to my liking, I was told that since it was a trio they couldn't do anything. I reluctantly accepted that explanation. I ordered the French onion soup which was also not as I had hoped. Finally, my daughter's cheeseburger...Even that was sub par. I won't even discuss the wait to pay, trouble using a $5 off $15 coupon, or the fact that I had to ask three different people to get me a manager when my server went AWOL. Just an added note...I never lost my temper or became the least bit rude and I did leave a tip. I will simply never return to this restaurant for a meal. The one star is for the mozzarella cheese sticks.

I was excited that we found one in town we sat down waitress was quick with us we order potatoes skins they change the cheese taste like the cheese in a can. We order hamburgers and they were just nasty fries we soggy on a good note the coke tasted like coke and for 2 kids meals and two hamburgers w as $51 I will never come again if I could put 0 stars I would

Went inside for lunch around 1:50 ordered some Mozzerella Cheese Sticks. They were barely warm, on the verge of not being cooked and greasy. Ordered a French Dip, the Aus Jus was served warm in a plastic cup amd the fries that came with were also barely cooked and tasted freezer burned. Thankfully our waiter was able to keep filling our drinks. Hopefully your server can get you drunk enough before your food comes so that you dont really remember what you ate when you left. I'm sure they'll have plenty of time to do so considering a French Dip and a Burger took about 30 minutes when this place was empty. There goes my first and last experience at TGI Fridays.

CAN I HAVE YOUR ATTENTION PLEASE!!! DO NOT EAT HERE... How many more bad reviews is this place going to get before something changes? Its just a matter of time before it shuts down for the second time. Go ahead and drive by anytime of the day and the place is a ghost town and is always empty. Its like walking into a morgue. If you eat here, you better be prepared for terrible service a very excessive wait for your food, which is comparable to Denny's quality. I can't for the life of me, figure out why people eat here? Its always dead and the atmosphere is very depressing! Don't go in for happy hour because you will just leave depressed and having a lot of regret and remorse. There are a ton of restaurant choices in this area that are so much better. The managment team needs a complete overhaul! Rick the so called " district manager" needs to be fired. He is very cocky and has zero customer service knowledge. It makes me wonder how he could have possibly landed that position? I guess he must have did a lot of ass kissing. This company just needs to give it up and go away!  Don't spend your money here because your buisness isn't appreciated, but by looks of how this place is always empty, I think people feel the same way.

Came here for the first time there was this Pregnant lady that sit us down and she wasn't too friendly at all more like she doesn't want to work at all!! then she have to wrk.. wasn't too sure what we want to order so me and a friend kept looking at the menu and one of the (guy) worker look at the pregnant lady and they both roll their eyes at us!!! I thought this was very disrespectful and I will never be returning to this TGIF in Roseville Ca Again!! Customer service sucks that's all I got to say!!

Fridays has been one of my favorite spots since 93. I'd go there for lunch during work and every once in a while in the evening for a cocktail when I lived in NY.  When I moved here I would visit the one in Citrus Heights only to be crushed when they closed. While in Roseville I saw this place and just had to go in to see if I could still order my "three for all" potato skins, buffalo wings and mozzarella cheese sticks.  I know those sound like pretty basic items but Fridays is the place for me when it comes to those three. I ordered it and it was as good as I remember it.  I also ordered the Jack Daniel's burger.  Smoked bacon and provolone cheese cooked medium and that burger was gone!

This place is a joke visited on 1/29/15 8:20 pm (about 15% full), was greated and immediately seated by the host. Sat about 15 minutes, with no acknowledgement until host walked by, this was after my 11 year old daughter told a different waitress we were waiting on service. Hailey was apparently our server, never had a chance to meet her but she obviously sucks at her job. It's a trickle down from management  since Jake the manager on duty and cannot even manage. The management has no business in the hospitality industry. I will call the store manager Jen to see if she has any competence, judging by the reviews this business will be gone in no time. How can I get my one star back?

Tried to go eat there tonight. Sat at the table for over 10 minutes and NO ONE came to take our order. No drinks no nothing. Had to ask for our waitress "Jen" who still DIDNT show up to help us. Got up to leave and the staff were just all standing there together DOING NOTHING and with the manager. They STILL didn't help us or even apologize. WORST place ever and it was our FIRST time. Place should be shut down. Look at the reviews...they are garbage!

I came here with a buddy and we had some appetizers and he had some beer. The specials were pretty good and the food was tasty. The best part of all was our bartender and the rest of the staff we encountered all asked if we were good and if everything was fine. The morale here is one of the best I have encountered in similar casual restauants. The workers seem to be happy and it shows. Friendly staff is the bottom line here. Will definitely return soon!

Our first clue should have been the broken front door. We were greeted by a gal who could not string a sentence together. We went to the bar and sat down. The bar was sticky and not clean. We were handed menus that were sticky and disgusting. The bartender barely said two words to us. The temperature inside the restaurant was at "sauna" level. This place should never have re-opened. We left...and went to Red Robin for a great lunch with clean, polite and prompt service. We will not be back...ever.

This is the TGI Fridays location in the Sacramento area = sad.  The restaurant is great however, they do not follow TV ad promotions (for TGI Fridays).  So don't go here expecting to get the promotions you see on TV.  They 'may' have something on their menu close to it, but not for certain.
Great food!! I love TGIs wings and Happy hour. If you want quick service sit at the bar the dining area is quite slow
Regular menu items Took a long time.  If You are celiac don't dine here.  Gluten sensitive isn't 100%.  Had a reaction immediately.  Wife and kid enjoyed half price appetizers.

Came here on a Saturday night to find out that this place is nothing compared to what it used to be few months ago. What happened?! Came with a group of 6 and it wasn't even overly crowded. Our food took over 45 minutes to come out. They forgot way too many things to even count but just to name a few.. We ordered one alcoholic drink right from the start which the waitress kept telling us it will be right out FOUR TIMES. Got it halfway through the meal. Someone asked for bbq sauce for their burger and he had to remind her twice and she still didn't even remember so he gave up on it. Until she came back and said "I never got that sauce for you did I?"........ Already done with burger. My friend asked for sweet potato fries instead of regular fries and they still put regular fries in her plate. She reminded our waitress and let's just say it did not come out "in a few minutes". I shared the pick 3 appetizers with someone and we only received two. We asked about the third one and she said she will be back with it. Already done with the first 2 and she came back and said they ran out of the one we ordered and no one told her. Great. Ordered another one and that was gross too. Oh and it didn't even come out until everyone was already done and ready for dessert. Too many apologies. The least they could have done was to comp the drink or our appetizer that they ran out of. It was just a horrible experience and I will never be coming back.

My husband and I met up with another couple for lunch. I was hesitant to go to TGI Fridays, because I had read several poor reviews about the customer service. However, I thought I should check it out for myself. Upon arriving, my husband tried to open the door, but it was stuck. A second later an employee opened for us. The same issue happened with another group after we had just exited the restaurant. The door needs to be fixed as soon as possible. The couple that tried to enter as we had just exited thought the restaurant was closed. After we were seated, we were promptly greeted by a female waitress named Kris. However, after she returned with our drinks she informed us that she was going on break and Robbie H. would be taking care of us. Robbie came after a few minutes and took our order. The food came and it was all a HUGE disappointment. My friend ordered the burger, it was OK. The bacon was undercooked and the burger needed a little love. My husband and I shared the baby back ribs, shrimp macaroni and cheese, and fries. The shrimp was the best thing on the plate. The fries were luke warm and appeared to have been sitting for awhile. The ribs lacked flavor and needed additional sauce. The macaroni and cheese was HORRIBLE! There was hardly any cheese and it wasn't warm. It looked like the chef heated some noodles and sprinkled some cheese on top. Then, put it in the microwave to slightly melt the cheese. Another friend ordered the sampler with a side of broccoli. The sampler was OK, but the broccoli was OVERCOOKED!  Although, the service was good...the food was horrible.

Went out with my siblings this past Saturday night about 8pm, good company & food was alright. But seriously, our service for the night sucked!  Our waiter looked so high and/or buzzed, after ordering food, he came out with our food, didn't even care to bring us any silverware/napkins. Another waitress had noticed and apologize, gave us our silverware. He came to see  if I wanted more water, I said "yes, please", I can see him walking past our table holding a cup of water and making his way back to the kitchen with the water, so no water I guess. I didn't care to bother asking- we were done here!

I should of  had a clue when I walked in at happy hour and no one was there.  Ordered a margarita and sent it back because it was awful.  Asked the waitress about happy hour and was told appetizers were 1/2 price.  Ordered and when was presented the bill app was full price.  when I inquired about the price I was told that particular app was not part of the 1/2 off promotion.  Waitress was rude and will never go again.  I guess customer service is not important to them.  They have lost a regular customer and now my friends will not go back there now.  Remember when you walk into somewhere and no one is there, must be a Good reason!!

I would give it a better rating if the tables were clean.  The table my wife and I were seated at today looked like it had not been throughly cleaned in a year!  The food was ok.  I was in the mood for some fried schrimp, which was very good, however we sat with napkins under our arms. The table next to us also complained. We said something to the server, and he stated "it was the varnish" well, if they know it's bad it's time to refinish!  Frankly, I did not want to touch the table, it was that bad.

Wow...I can't believe this place is still in business.  The service was terrible from our hostess to our server to the manager who just wanted us gone.  Our food was cold and when we asked for it to be warmed up....we never got it back...wth?!  The portions on the kids menu were for 2-3yr olds...that was a direct quote from the manager....I had to go buy the family dinner after we had dinner...what a joke.  Not only will I never be back, I will tell this story to my 150 employees as well as all my friends and family.   You do the math.

Severely disappointed in the service provided. Server refused to smile through out the entire experience. I ordered a mojito because she said they make them fresh  and muddle the mint themselves. Oh and by the way she was also the bartender. Mind you when she brought it to me. It looked very  foggy as if the mix was wrong. I tasted it anyways to choke down a whole mint leaf from the bottom of the glass. I moved the straw and all the whole leaves floated up. She didn't muddle it at all. She just through the mint in the glass and served it. :( I thought well I will just order something she can't goof up. I ordered a coke, and she brought me a diet coke.
