LMAO , it never seems to amaze me, I always have the Best or the worst service no matter where I go. Wish for just once I could have the average server. I'm not asking for a miracle, but don't get mad if the food is messed up and your customer asks for something different. ~ This was not a good wexperience in customer service.  However I had a great visit with my friends and the Jack Daniels sesame chicken was fantastic!

This place is terrible!!!!!!! The host was very rude and acted like we were an inconvenience. We tried to be patient and show some grace, but after 25 we still hadn't even received our WATER. I have been a server for almost 8 years and I couldn't have been more disappointed in the service. We ended up leaving and walking across the street to red robin. Don't waste your time with this place.

Worst dining experience EVER. The service was terrible and Dylan, the "manager," is a hot headed, power tripping creep.  We got there about 7pm. Got appetizers about 7:30. Entrees served about 8. They forgot my kid's food. I reminded them. At 8:10, his food was still not there. At 8:15, the server came and apologized and made an excuse about having "four tables," and promised it would be only 3-5 minutes. I asked for some fries or something to hold my child over in the meantime and she refused. My other kid vomited at the table and I took him to the bathroom to clean him up. I came out at 8:25, he still had no food. I packed my family up and informed the hostess that we were leaving because it was unacceptable for them to leave a 5 year old hungry while everyone else around him ate. I informed her that my food was also still there, because I couldn't eat in front of my hungry child. She apologized and said she understood. As we were buckling the kids in the car, Dylan came out yelling at us and telling us that he would be calling the cops on us for leaving without paying. When I told him that the service was unacceptable, he made excuses about the server being new and having a lot of tables (4 is apparently too many?). He said their policy is that customers have to speak with a manager. Well, I don't know their policy, and the hostess never asked us to stick around and talk to him. He said the server also never informed him that we were upset, and that sometimes they try "be sneaky" and not get the manager involved. Sounds like they have a serious personnel issue. Long story short, he told me they would "eat the bill" and that I could just leave. I asked him to confirm that he would not be calling the police and his response was, "We'll make a decision about that later after I call my general manager." Excuse me? Like I'm going to drive away and have you accuse me of theft?! I demanded that he call his general manager right away and instead, he did call the cops! I had to wait there in the cold with my 5 year old crying because he was hungry and scared and wanted to go home and my 1 year old freezing because he had no clothes on (because he puked on them). When they arrived, the officer I spoke with agreed that there is no excuse for lousy service. I told him that I would gladly pay for the one person's meal that got eaten, but not for mine or the one we never got. Apparently Dylan told the other officer that they would write if off, but that I'm not welcome there ever again. No worries, Dylan, sweetie... You couldn't pay me to come back if that's the way that you treat your customers. Now it's after 9pm and my poor kid STILL hasn't eaten. You should be ashamed of yourself for subjecting my children to that spectacle and for wasting two patrol cars worth of police officer's time when I'm sure they had much more important things to attend to. Jerk.

This location does not participate in the endless appetizers for $12. And apparently not the drink specials either. Very disappointed.  Their excuse is that because they are a franchise they can choose not to honor the corporate sponsored special offers. Hmm seems to me there should have been some signage on the front door.

Came here to specifically get the appetizer deal I saw on TV and this location doesn't participate in the deal. Ok so we ordered food (party of 6) I can honestly say everything was terrible. Should of yelped this place first,  then at least I would have saw the 2 stars. We will NEVER come back.

I came to this location around 3pm today (Monday, March 30, 2015) and the doors were locked. While ringing the restaurant on my cell, I watched as customer after customer rattled the handles of the front door and then drove away. The employee who answered was not apologetic and never offered to let us in. I'm not sure what's going on here - but whatever it is, it needs to be fixed.
Good place in overall. Weekends and evenings it gets busy and staff can't keep up with everything. Food and drinks tend to take longer, etc.

Stopped in for happy hour after shopping with a friend.  Prices were reasonable but the food was sub par. The potato skins had freezer burn and they poured melted cheese over them. These were not real potato skins and tasted lousy.  The jack chicken was dried out hunk of chicken jerkey. I don't recommend the happy hour menu

Walked in on a Saturday afternoon, it was dead yet we didn't get greeted for 5 minutes. Got seated in back corner next to the only two tables of people. I was immediately irritated by the atmosphere and service, it was dark and crammed inside. Our waitress was very friendly . She never gave her name  but her service was pretty good. The food was ok nothing special I probably would've rather had mcdonalds. Won't go here again.

Love this place, go here for lunch with my wife a few times a month and this place is bread. Ordered the Barbados rum punch and it was brought to us in less than 5 mins. I got the jack Daniels sampler and my wife got the lunch salad and they were amazing. The server was great, Dee I believe her name was and she kept up with us and made sure we were taken care of. Love this place, good food good price and awesome atmosphere.

Food isn't very good, had a burger it was like the cheapest hamburger patty and some fries were hard,others over cooked.  Slow service in bar area. They are not doing the happy hour every hour like the commercials say

The service was horrible and the food was not any better. The server was rude,  took our order and that was literally the last time we saw him.  Someone else brought our (soggy,  undercooked)  food.  We never even received any refills. We ended up not eating our entrees and only picking at the appetizer we ordered.  Since we were never checked on,  we couldn't ask for a remake or our food.  We had to find ANOTHER server to provide us our check.  This was the first time I've visited this location,  and will never  visit again.

We came here during lunch on Saturday and it was also happy hour. I must say that the happy hour options were pretty good. $4 tall Shock Tops, and $5 spinach dip, which was very good by the way, was an awesome deal. I also ordered the Chicken Cobb Salad with Caesar Vinaigrette. This was a great hearty salad and filled me up, however, neither of these made up for the terrible service. This location gets only 3 stars because our waiter seemed drunk and took forever to get out stuff. I forget his name, but if any mangers are reading this it was the guy with dark hair who waited in the bar area last Saturday. He needs a Breathalyzer before his shift for sure.

My wife & I were gonna pop in for some of their "Happy hour, every hour" specials we've been seeing on TV lately. WRONG!! When we got to the front door there is a hand written sign saying that this TGIF does NOT participate in the current promotion. So we turned around & left. I'm thinking this TGIF will be out of business soon. For the second time! Won't be back. There are too many better places offering good happy hour deals in Roseville.

I used to love the old school days of the flare that TGI Fridays staff would wear.  The food used to be alright, however fast forward 10 years and this place needed help.  We were sat in the booth and there was ketchup on their booth wall.  The server had poor service...seeemed uninterested.  I won't go back anytime soon.

If you want overpriced, greasy food, you'll love it here! What a flashback from the 80s. TGIF used to be the 'cool' place when I was in college in So Cal. Sure has gone down hill. They've tried to update their menu. The pictures don't compare to what is delivered. I ordered the fried green beans. Was expecting the mouthwatering, delicate fries like Hawk's in Granite Bay. Not. This is a step up from fast food fries, but on a plate.  Server was attentive, and they do have some happy hour specials. Overall, felt dead and dated inside. Sorry TGIF. Maybe it's time for a 'restaurant makeover.'

Came in here with a group of friends and we all ordered the same drinks double berry mojitos and the bartender made them so bad that I thought I was drinking straight juice. And when we said something to him about it he was pretty much a douche bag and claimed he was the manager on duty and that he knows he made them right. I work in retail so I know that even if I didn't make a mistake that I would try to fix it. But when I spoke to another server she said that he wasn't the manager. Like this guy is a giant asshole. This place is never busy and now I know why it's Shayne the so called "manager"

Where do I start?  I use to hang out at the old TGI Friday's in the Arden area before they shut it down years ago and loved it.  Was very sad that it closed and the closest one is this one which is a drive for me but I am glad that I made the drive after so man years.  I first went to TGI Friday's about  6 months ago and loved the food, especially the Long Island Iced Tea.  Since then I've been 3 times and going to review my last visit which was yesterday.   I ordered the Jack Daniel's burger and WOW it was good.  Nice and juicy with Signature Jack Daniel's sauce, applewood-smoked bacon and melted provolone cheese.  I mean this thing was dripping all over my plate and hands. Soooooo Good!  Then it came with these amazing season fries. I also of course got another Long Island Iced Tea.  Happy Hour is all day, every day so it only cost $4 and would get more if I wasn't driving.  Now I know why I keep coming back.   Now your thinking if I loved it so much why the 4 stars?  Well it's not the cleanest place in the world.  I know I'm at a chain restaurant and not expecting fine dining but the table was a little greasy.  Just think a little more attention to cleanliness would of brought it up to 5 stars. I see that this place is getting allot of bad reviews but I would recommend it.  Food is good and our waiter was there if we needed him for a refill on drinks of anything else we need.

Was given gift card to TGI Friday and after reading all the negative reviews I was concerned. I called the corporation as I wanted to enjoy my experience as it would be my first time here. I must say The service was wonderful, food was great. I would encourage all who had a bad experience to give a second chance. There were several different people other than our waiter who came to our table to see if everything was satisfactory. As far as the prices, I would say they are pretty in line with all other places.

Horrible service! Or more like lack of service. The restaurant was empty besides for 1 other guy who came in just after us. He placed his drink and lunch order, received his drink, and we sat only 10 feet away and weren't even asked what we wanted to drink.  Kept looking around but all the servers were busy chatting it up in the back at the other side of the bar.  We just left...
This restaurant is franchised and doesn't participate in the commercial promotions seen on TV or elsewhere.
Closed down again!!! Very sad, I loved the sesame Jack chicken strips!!! This was a great location, we always got great service.

I'm sad because I loved the Fridays by sunrise mall when I was younger. This place was a shit hole when it closed the first time and merely better now that it closed again. I went three times at different hours and they all sucked. Poor service , awful food and expensive to boot.  It's a shame such a once great and fun brand fell into sizzler territory

Sadly, we got stripes coupons from their website - stating they were still open at this location. (I was there a lil over a month ago & it was open, although yelpers reported it being closed).  Well, SADLY, it is INDEED CLOSED. ALL Sacramento area TGI Fridays are now closed: Elk Grove, Roseville, and the forever ago closed down Howe Ave location in Sacramento.   Save a drive folks - THEY ARE CLOSED FOR BUSINESS - GONE COMPLETELY.
